title: Bug 6009: New class wizard doesn't set the correct context for nested classes
description: When using the new class wizard, the context for nested classes is not being set correctly.
OB: When attempting to create a new nested class using the wizard, the 'Enclosing Type' field remains blank.
EB: The 'Enclosing Type' field in the new class wizard should default to the current type displayed in the editor.
SR: To reproduce the issue, use Build 20011106. Have a .java file open in the editor, then click the new class button. Check the 'Enclosing Type' field; it should default to the type currently open in the editor.
